help-file.title: EXPERIENCE XP EXP LEVELS
help-file.content:
Syntax: exp (to see how much experience you currently have)
Whenever you kill a monster or a player, you earn experience points. Once you have earned enough experience, you raise a level in your class. Duris has 56 mortal levels; you can check your progress by typing 'experience'. The levels after 50 are only received by quaffing a specific potion, found in zones.
Here are a few things you should know about experience points:
-Each pulse you hit or miss a monster when you are engaged you get experience points. -Healing a person who is in combat and grouped with you will give you a lot of experience points. -You get exp for each spell you cast upon a monster or a player in your group if you are in combat. The amount of experience points received depends on which circle the spells is in. You also receive experience points for using skills in combat, such as bash, backstab, kick and so on. -If you kill a monster of a higher level than yourself, you get bonus experience points. -If you kill a monster of a lower level, you will gain less experience points.
